plugins.name: windows-cupy-nvrtc
plugins.description: Fix CuPy NVRTC compilation errors on Windows. Trigger: (1) NVRTC_ERROR_BUILTIN_OPERATION_FAILURE, (2) nvrtc-builtins64_xxx.dll not found, (3) CuPy JIT compilation fails on Windows.

plugins.name: project-data-separation
plugins.description: Pattern for separating repository code from user data and notebooks. Trigger: (1) organizing scientific pipelines, (2) separating code from data, (3) creating project management frameworks.

plugins.name: backtest-datetime-visualization
plugins.description: Converting backtest visualizations from bar indices to actual datetime axes. Triggers: (1) plots showing 'Bar' or 'Timestep' instead of dates, (2) equity curve x-axis showing integers, (3) drawdown plots using range(len(data)), (4) trade P&L charts using trade numbers instead of entry times

plugins.name: dashboard-pnl-visualization
plugins.description: Trading dashboard P&L visualization with profit tracker integration. Triggers: (1) adding win-rate overlays to P&L panels, (2) splitting realized vs unrealized P&L, (3) displaying R-multiples for positions, (4) integrating broker equity history, (5) configurable dashboard runtime settings

plugins.name: markov-regime-features
plugins.description: Debugging and implementing dynamic Markov regime features in RL observations. Triggers: (1) Markov features appear constant in observation heatmaps, (2) uniform priors [0.33, 0.34, 0.33] instead of actual regime probabilities, (3) InferenceObservationBuilder not updating states, (4) HMM regime detection not reflecting market conditions

plugins.name: symbol-selection-statistical
plugins.description: Statistical symbol selection for algorithmic trading. Triggers: (1) selecting stocks/crypto for mean-reversion or momentum strategies, (2) finding assets compatible with GARCH volatility models, (3) building diversified trading portfolios, (4) evaluating Hurst exponent or half-life characteristics

plugins.name: python-performance-patterns
plugins.description: Low-risk Python performance optimizations. Trigger: (1) performance audit findings, (2) slow file operations, (3) O(n^2) loops, (4) repeated function calls, (5) sequential I/O bottlenecks.

plugins.name: pypi-collision-fix
plugins.description: Fix PyPI package name collisions when local package name exists on PyPI. Trigger: (1) pip installs wrong package version, (2) 'pip install package[extra]' downloads from PyPI instead of using local, (3) editable install gets overwritten.

plugins.name: hpc-dev-testing-workflow
plugins.description: Efficient development testing workflow for HPC environments with VS Code tunneling. Trigger: testing code changes on HPC, development workflow with external data directories, VS Code Remote SSH development

plugins.name: conda-multi-account-hipergator
plugins.description: Set up conda with multiple group storage locations on HiPerGator. Trigger: (1) conda envs on shared storage, (2) multiple conda installations, (3) HiPerGator environment setup, (4) shared group conda environments.

plugins.name: skills-registry-organization
plugins.description: Organize Skills Registry for cross-project reuse. Trigger: (1) setting up skills registry as submodule, (2) deciding project-specific vs shared skills, (3) reorganizing skills for multiple repos.

plugins.name: dependency-deprecation
plugins.description: Pattern for deprecating external dependencies while maintaining backward compatibility. Trigger: (1) removing Java/FIJI/MATLAB dependencies, (2) deprecating optional dependencies, (3) migrating to pure Python implementations.

plugins.name: type-checking-pattern
plugins.description: Fix F821 undefined name errors for optional dependencies using TYPE_CHECKING pattern. Trigger: (1) ruff F821 errors for type hints, (2) undefined name in type annotation, (3) optional dependency type hints.

plugins.name: example-skill
plugins.description: Example skill demonstrating registry structure. Trigger: (1) setting up a new skills registry, (2) learning the skill format.

plugins.name: gpu-parallel-scheduling
plugins.description: GPU-safe parallel processing for KINTSUGI: (1) Queue-based GPU allocation to prevent OOM, (2) Avoiding nested ThreadPoolExecutor, (3) Main-thread progress output for Jupyter. Trigger: kernel crash during parallel processing, OOM error, nested ThreadPoolExecutor, multi-GPU scheduling, CuPy thread safety.

plugins.name: gpu-memory-cleanup
plugins.description: CuPy GPU memory cleanup to prevent Jupyter cell hangs: (1) Explicit memory pool cleanup after GPU processing, (2) Preventing lazy cleanup hangs. Trigger: cell hanging, GPU memory, CuPy cleanup, Jupyter hang, processing complete but cell still running.

plugins.name: basic-caching-evaluation
plugins.description: Evaluation of BaSiC illumination correction caching strategies. Trigger: (1) optimizing BaSiC performance, (2) considering caching for illumination correction, (3) sparse marker handling in microscopy.

plugins.name: repo-project-sync-workflow
plugins.description: KINTSUGI repo-to-project sync workflow: Always edit main repo (/blue/maigan/smith6jt/KINTSUGI/) first, then sync to project folders. Trigger: editing Kdecon, Kstitch, Kreg, Kview2 modules; fix not working after edit; syncing between repos; KINTSUGI_Projects folder edits.

plugins.name: channel-name-parsing
plugins.description: Multi-format channel name parsing for KINTSUGI: (1) Simple list format (one per line), (2) Cycle-prefixed formats (colon, tab, CSV). Trigger: CHANNELNAMES.txt, channel names, marker names, parsing channel file, channel metadata.

plugins.name: tile-snake-pattern-stitching
plugins.description: KINTSUGI tile acquisition patterns for stitching: (1) SNAKE pattern - even rows L→R, odd rows R→L, (2) RASTER pattern - all rows L→R. Trigger: stitching, tile order, acquisition pattern, SNAKE vs RASTER, tile coordinates, image mosaic, grid pattern.

plugins.name: gpu-quality-priority
plugins.description: KINTSUGI processing principles: (1) Never sacrifice quality for speed, (2) Always use GPU when available - no CPU fallback, (3) Adding 'fast mode' options that reduce quality. Trigger: performance optimization, CPU/GPU choice, fast mode, quality vs speed tradeoff.

plugins.name: persistent-cache-gap-filling
plugins.description: Persistent data cache with gap-filling for historical market data. Trigger when: (1) cache re-downloads complete data unnecessarily, (2) time-based cache expiry wastes API calls, (3) historical data needs incremental updates only.
